title: How to Draw Hello Kitty

steps.headline: Draw a large oval for the head.
steps.description: Make sure you add in guidelines in the center of the oval for the eyes and nose: they are very helpful to draw the facial features. They should cross as seen, so you can use them in the next step when you add those features.

steps.headline: Sketch in two ovals for the eyes.
steps.description: Between and below them, draw another small oval for her nose.

steps.headline: Add two triangles for the ears, and three lines in each cheek for the whiskers.
steps.description: They can vary in length and flair; the usual style is shown here.

steps.headline: At the left ear, start drawing her ribbon.
steps.description: Draw a large circle and two small circles on each side overlapping the large one. Draw two triangles in each side of the circle with curved sides.

steps.headline: Draw a large, round-edged triangle.
steps.description: Draw two ovals for the feet.

steps.headline: For the arms, draw ovals for each.
steps.description: Don't forget two circles for her thumb! Hello Kitty doesn't really have fingers, like a human, or paws, like a cat; her look is unique to her, so try hard to get it right.

steps.headline: Add in her clothes.
steps.description: She usually wears a jumper and a shirt. (You can dress her in any kind of clothing you’d like, though!)

steps.headline: Outline the image.
steps.description: Erase the guidelines and any other unnecessary marks.now your hello kitty's basic sketch is ready! !

steps.headline: Color in your drawing.
steps.description: Use primarily shades of pink, with a dot of yellow for her nose and darker eyes/whiskers. You're done!

steps.headline: Draw an oblong which matches the big head of Hello Kitty.
Draw a purse-shape below the oblong.
steps.description: Draw a vertical line at the middle of the two shapes.

steps.headline: Draw the hands or arms using curve lines.
steps.description: Draw small circles in each arm.

steps.headline: Draw lines in the body for the clothes.
Draw details for Hello Kitty’s ears, eyes, nose, and whiskers.
Draw a flower at the right upper part of the head.
Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.

tyn: Crayons, Markers, Colored Pencils, or Paint
text: A Sitting Hello Kitty Draw a large oval for the head. Make sure you add in guidelines in the center of the oval for the eyes and nose: they are very helpful to draw the facial features. They should cross as seen, so you can use them in the next step when you add those features. Sketch in two ovals for the eyes. Between and below them, draw another small oval for her nose. Add two triangles for the ears, and three lines in each cheek for the whiskers. They can vary in length and flair; the usual style is shown here. At the left ear, start drawing her ribbon. Draw a large circle and two small circles on each side overlapping the large one. Draw two triangles in each side of the circle with curved sides. Draw a large, round-edged triangle. Draw two ovals for the feet. For the arms, draw ovals for each. Don't forget two circles for her thumb! Hello Kitty doesn't really have fingers, like a human, or paws, like a cat; her look is unique to her, so try hard to get it right. Add in her clothes. She usually wears a jumper and a shirt. (You can dress her in any kind of clothing you’d like, though!) Outline the image. Erase the guidelines and any other unnecessary marks.now your hello kitty's basic sketch is ready! ! Color in your drawing. Use primarily shades of pink, with a dot of yellow for her nose and darker eyes/whiskers. You're done! A Standing Hello Kitty Draw an oblong which matches the big head of Hello Kitty.  Draw a purse-shape below the oblong. Draw a vertical line at the middle of the two shapes. Draw the hands or arms using curve lines. Draw small circles in each arm. Draw lines in the body for the clothes.  Draw details for Hello Kitty’s ears, eyes, nose, and whiskers.  Draw a flower at the right upper part of the head.  Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.  Color to your liking!
sentences: A Sitting Hello Kitty Draw a large oval for the head.
Make sure you add in guidelines in the center of the oval for the eyes and nose: they are very helpful to draw the facial features.
They should cross as seen, so you can use them in the next step when you add those features.
Sketch in two ovals for the eyes.
Between and below them, draw another small oval for her nose.
Add two triangles for the ears, and three lines in each cheek for the whiskers.
They can vary in length and flair; the usual style is shown here.
At the left ear, start drawing her ribbon.
Draw a large circle and two small circles on each side overlapping the large one.
Draw two triangles in each side of the circle with curved sides.
Draw a large, round-edged triangle.
Draw two ovals for the feet.
For the arms, draw ovals for each.
Don't forget two circles for her thumb!
Hello Kitty doesn't really have fingers, like a human, or paws, like a cat; her look is unique to her, so try hard to get it right.
Add in her clothes.
She usually wears a jumper and a shirt.
(You can dress her in any kind of clothing you’d like, though!)
Outline the image.
Erase the guidelines and any other unnecessary marks.now your hello kitty's basic sketch is ready!
Color in your drawing.
Use primarily shades of pink, with a dot of yellow for her nose and darker eyes/whiskers.
You're done!
A Standing Hello Kitty Draw an oblong which matches the big head of Hello Kitty.
Draw a purse-shape below the oblong.
Draw a vertical line at the middle of the two shapes.
Draw the hands or arms using curve lines.
Draw small circles in each arm.
Draw lines in the body for the clothes.
Draw details for Hello Kitty’s ears, eyes, nose, and whiskers.
Draw a flower at the right upper part of the head.
Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.
Color to your liking!
